contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist | name = Zoran Predin | image = Radio City prijateljem 2008 (06).jpg | caption = Predin in 2008 | image_size = | color = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Zoran Predin | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1958|6|16}} | death_date = | origin = [[Maribor]], [[Slovenija]] | instrument = [[Guitar]] | genre = [[pop music|Pop]], [[rock music|rock]], [[jazz]] | occupation = [[Musician]], [[singer]], [[songwriter]], [[record producer]] | years_active = 1980–present | label = [[Helidon (music label)|Helidon]], [[Discoton]], [[Conan (music label)|Conan]], [[Kud Levi breg]], [[Dallas Records]], [[Hayat Production]] | associated_acts = [[Lačni Franz]]. | website = http://www.predin.com/ | notable_instruments = }} '''Zoran Predin''' (born 16 June 1958) is a [[Slovenia]]n [[singer-songwriter]] from [[Maribor]]. In the 1980s, he was the front man of the folk-rock band ''[[Lačni Franz]]''. He also writes music for film, television and theatre.<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.predin.com/biography |title=Biography |publisher=Official website}}</ref> In the late 1990s and early 2000s, he went on several tours with the rock singers [[Pero Lovšin]] and [[Vlado Kreslin]].<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.mladina.si/tednik/200301/clanek/reklame/ |title=Pesem za tolar |publisher=[[Mladina]] |date=2003-01 |language=Slovenian}}</ref> Among others, they composed the anthem of the [[Slovenia national football team]] for the [[2000 European Football Championship]]. He has also been active in public life. In the late 1990s, he publicly supported the leftist [[Liberal Democracy of Slovenia]].<ref>{{citation| url=http://www.playboy.si/branje/intervju/zoran-predin/2/ |title=Interview: Zoran Predin |publisher=Playboy Slovenia |date=2006-02-01 |language=Slovenian}}</ref> == Solo discography == Albums:<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.predin.com/discography |title=Discography |publisher=Official website}}</ref> *[[Svjedoci-Priče]] (1989) *[[Gate na glavo]] (1992) *[[Napad ljubezni]] (1994) *[[Mentol bonbon]] (1996) *[[Ljubimec iz omare]] (1998) *[[All-purpose lover]] (1999) *[[Tretji človek]] (2000) *[[Lovec na sanje]] (2001) *[[V živo gre zares]] (2002) *[[Praslovan MP3]] (2002) *[[Strup za punce]] (2003) *[[Na krilih prvega poljuba]] (2003) *[[Žarnica za boljši jutri]] (2005) *[[Čas za malo nežnosti]] (2006) *[[Za šaku ljubavi]] (2007) *[[Pod srečno zvezdo]] (2008) *[[Inventura (album)|Inventura]] (2008) ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *[http://www.predin.com/ Official website] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Predin, Zoran | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Slovenian singer-songwriter | DATE OF BIRTH =16 June 1958 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Predin, Zoran}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Slovenian singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Yugoslav musicians]] [[Category:People from Maribor]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Slovenia-musician-stub}}
